availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wallis Baley (Magoffin County, Kentucky, court clerk)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer and court clerk. Virginia native. Married to Mary "Polly" Bailey. Father of Allen C. Bailey, John D. Bailey, Melisa Bailey, William P. Bailey, Lewis P. Bailey, James F. Bailey, Narcisa P. Bailey. Wallis W. Bailey, Nancy J. Bailey, Alexander Bailey, and Enoch M. Bailey. Farmer in Magoffin County, Kentucky in 1860. Clerk of the Magoffin County Court from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Floyd County, My District, p. 456B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 442.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), p. 306.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), p. 12.
Find A Grave, "Wallace Marion Bailey (1802-1885)," Memorial #167426708, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/167426708 (accessed May 19, 2020).
